message.content:
cs.CV, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.ME, cs.NI 

The paper presents a method for semi-automatically identifying and quantifying ablation gaps in pulmonary vein isolation using cardiac magnetic resonance imaging. This involves image segmentation, graph-based analysis, and statistical analysis of gap distribution. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are computer vision (cs.CV) and machine learning (cs.LG), as these are the primary techniques used in the paper. Additionally, artificial intelligence (cs.AI) is also a likely sub-category given the use of automated methods. The paper also involves medical imaging (cs.ME) and networking and internet architecture (cs.NI) due to the use of cardiac magnetic resonance imaging and the potential for remote analysis of the data.
